desc:
"Since day one, three years ago, we did our best to put values and principles that brought cryptography to be developed in the first place at the center of our activity and this helped us in creating and gathering amazing human beings that are advancing human freedom online" opens our very own PG the start of Ethereum Cypherpunk Congress. Sharing about Web3PrivacyNow, our values, the book, many events and much more that we managed to accomplish so far. Opening talk is then followed by message from Roman Storm from Tornado Cash.

Ethereum Cypherpunk Congress by Web3Privacy Now is the world's largest cypherpunk and human rights event.
4500 people gathering in Buenos Aires to celebrate privacy with internet freedom leaders like Richard Stallman, Vitalik Buterin, Roger Dingledine, and Eva Galperin. 

Join us in building a free internet for all.

Website: https://web3privacy.info/
Congress site: https://congress.web3privacy.info/
name: ECC#2 Opening Talk + Roman Storm Message

desc:
“Privacy is necessary for an open society in the
electronic age.” says Filecoin's Kurt Opsahl in his presentation where he discusses Cypherpunk future that  we would want to live in. One, where tech serves to people, doesn't end with development and stands by the values of privacy, freedom and responsibility.

Ethereum Cypherpunk Congress by Web3Privacy Now is the world's largest cypherpunk and human rights event.
4500 people gathering in Buenos Aires to celebrate privacy with internet freedom leaders like Richard Stallman, Vitalik Buterin, Roger Dingledine, and Eva Galperin. 

Join us in building a free internet for all.

Website: https://web3privacy.info/
Congress site: https://congress.web3privacy.info/
name: Creating the Cypherpunk Future we'd want to live in

desc:
"Our mission is to defend the rights of individuals to build and use free and open cryptocurrency
networks: the right to write and publish code – to read and to run it. The right to assemble into
peer-to-peer networks. And the right to do all this privately." says Peter Van Valkenburg about CoinCenter in his presentation. Here he talks about building, cryptography, bitcoin and CoinCetnters report "Tear down this Walled garden".


Ethereum Cypherpunk Congress by Web3Privacy Now is the world's largest cypherpunk and human rights event.

name: The Freedom to Build and what should we build?

desc:
Speech by Free Software Society's Richard Stallman about importance of open source and free software. Talks how one should never believe anyone who controls what software you are using does, about Google and much more.

desc:
Presentation by Eva Galperin from Electronic Frontier Foundation where she describes fascism, cyberfascism, what it is and how it can be countered by us. Discusses IBM's and Microsoft's parts in helping with surveillance and urges people to build in decentralized manner and with marginalized people in mind.

name: Cyberfascism: what is it and how we can fight it?

desc:
Here Renata Avila from Open Knowledge Foundation shares her thoughts and wishes for Cypherpunk movement. Discusses emerging alliances in cryptography circles, autonomous pihlantropy, but also talks about WikiLeaks as example of moment that could have shaken society and help form privacy oriented movement but in the end came up as a rather divisive one.

desc:
"Transparency for Tor is key" states Tor's own Roger Dingledine in his presentation focusing on lessons from Tor. Covering importance of anonymity and transparency, showcasing how Tor works and even user-cases showing how privacy and anonymity is essential for eveyrone, be it radical political activist, doctor in town and everyone in between.

desc:
Thinkpiece by Daira Emma Hopwood where they contemplate what cypherpunks can and should do for marginalized communities in order to protect everyone's privacy and freedom. In spite of private organizing in actvist cirles struggling to attract more people to viewing crypto as joke or scam by leftists, they plead for cypherpunks to build privacy tools that are better on all axes for all people and also build resistent movements.
